newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU clears non-military parts of BAE/Lagardere deal.
newsitem.headline: EU clears non-military parts of BAE/Lagardere deal.

text.p: The European Commission said on Tuesday it had cleared under competition rules the non-military aspects of a joint venture between British Aerospace and France's Lagardere.
The military aspects of the deal will be decided by France and Britain.

The Commission said it had cleared the joint venture because the combined market share of the two parent companies was "low" and that therefore the deal would not create or strengthen a dominant position within the European Union.
It said the companies had not submitted the military parts of the deal -- which concerns guided weapons and associated systems -- following instructions from the French and British government.
The Commission said such instructions were normal under European Union merger rules.
